description.narrative: 1. Add value to the Ethiopia economy by moving from import model to local soap production operation which provides direct and indirect employment to the local community and contributes to the government revenue 2. Bring FDI into Ethiopia, thereby encouraging other foreign investments to the country 3. Transfer of knowledge and know-how on soap-making 4. Introduction of international standards in corporate governance including financial management 5. Foster increased competition and quality in the Ethiopian soap industry through the addition of high-quality soap production facilities in Ethiopia

IFC is proposing an equity investment in a proposed Joint Venture Project (Project) to set-up a soap manufacturing operation in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. The proposed Project initially involves importing palm oil based soap noodles produced by Musim Mas Group (MM or the Group) in Indonesia, value adding and packaging these soap noodles into soap bars in the proposed plant, to be sold in the Ethiopian market, with the possibility of exporting to neighboring countries.
